comment.author: 15456017@N05
comment._content: The T. Eaton Co. Limited was once Canada's largest department store retailer. It was founded in 1869 in Toronto by Timothy Eaton, a Presbyterian Ulster Scot immigrant from what is now Northern Ireland. Eaton's grew to become a retail and social institution in Canada, with stores across the country, buying offices across the globe, and a catalogue that was found in the homes of most Canadians. A changing economic and retail environment in the late 20th century, and mismanagement culminated in the chain's bankruptcy in 1999. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eaton's The name of the large shopping mall in central Toronto, the Eaton Centre , is all that remains of the great national chain of department stores.
